text: This is the BBC. This podcast is supported by advertising outside the UK. This Leicester Dolok-Giwof-Gi from BBC Radio Nengale. This is Leicester Dolok-Giwis from BBC Radio Nongale. In this is Leicester, Dulloch-Giwis, Learue, Leigh, is the letter 1,000, 8 in 1. The cooeship rye of Ryev is Dahl Alastar Makhynich. There are no scriveter and no arisicicah. Scribe a leo in Cretu Mithus and Anthropialus. I'm a dollahorsed soul in the lehorechin, Ike. Had in the Sanyong, chad the hookugach dal, in the Gaelic. Rooka, on a crumbia, on the ross in the year, on the 8-1-2-6-3. Hucket is skilin-mart, not a glassach, on the glth year 6th of 3. He's skilin'art 9th, on the glasocku. On the 2ndiard 2nd, it gluice it in the Gaelthach. There is Nyeasic on the Feper Neark the North Star. In that, there was an Don Jee and Donajan, ascribock on the paper in Nearch. There are Uy Vorek of Eadus, or Mythology. In the MISC of Ljurichin'Legian, Indian Fairy Stories, Myths from Melanesia and Indonesia, and Crete and pre-Hellenic myths and legends. Chara Opper and Avechon, Gounsbitch. Mare example, Aounsendorke Wondertills from Scottish Myth in Legend, ha, the whole call, the Bairdha, and chanel the daughter a selerach in the Tewaneky. Cahew, I'm in the rothan the heart of the Cappetial on that in the law that. If you're eaule in the Gael, it would it of a bit hean on harsed in chriti in the Gael, it would beck heine to hear of Chretaceach in the High. In Capitral O'un, we are Beera Queen of Winter. And this, Steehik, Ere or Vera, character large on the Beal Arish in the Gael. This, as the countess a much-gony a tautoshach. Dark Beera was the Mother of All the God Arish N'gail. This, madah an coontas a machchnich atosych. Dark Beera was the mother of all the gods and goddesses in Scotland. She was of great height and very old and everyone feared her. When roused to anger, she was as fierce as the biting north wind and harsh as the tempest-stricken sea. Each winter she reigned as queen of the four red divisions of the world. Hashin a shaltin, giville, givil in texashthy, it dolechus in Gael. Chavig the Four Red Divisions of the World a kielachug-datt, on the Sule the Bairda. But canny that's in the haste on the Gaelic that they have the brain in the Toul in the Fat, Khear Rannan, Rueg, and Dawn, the four Red Divisions of the World. The Teges of Makhunich the world. And the text I'mchunuch, I can't go a chalach Vera a fan bath to Aous to Ackal Ushka Sancho a top the ha ha the topar to Lorock in the Yelan Oannia Eelan a viz a flot on Tufinier and that the Sauru that in the Eilandia, Elan, a viz, a flot, on the Tewan Yere. Ha, the sauerg on that the Kahnie. When I gollug in the Tushka, there was a farce Oakh a rizht, but had, the sigger at all shaket, he's agie sheen atiehs, and Lishanous, hikig, drachund, and ferrek. Gadeh, Vee Grahamach. Charrow Echee, a one soull. It was a fiechlan, Rue, Mareverick, and it was a falt chokial, re-canachant-leva. It was a cuthoutich, lea, and was charler oar, harish in the goalien. Chai, irthegna gaelthach. Har the gra, gree a chruik of of the Bein on a shirrach grosh. And in a hechon, e'en shrew me give that the chruiky, loch on in the Eregeau.
